channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned bike, 25th June
item.description:
10 m further up the road and crossing the street Iâ€™ve come across yet another forest bike illegally abandoned the middle of the pavement. This forest organisation is clearly designed by idiots for idiots who have absolutely no respect for the rest of society. Pedestrian should not have to weave around these illegally about their bikes when they are dedicated base painted by the council on the pavement specifically for the purpose of responsibly, leaving these bikes where it is safe for pedestrians to be able to continue their journey.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, The Cut, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike, 25th June
item.description:
Another selfish moron has left an abandoned forest bike in the middle of the pavement on a very busy pedestrian street clearly no respect for any other human being on the planet just like the human forest organisation and each policy in the first place get rid of it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greet Street, Waterloo, London

item.title: Fly tipping as seen on photos, 25th June
item.description:
This fly tipping is a constant problem in Lemmon Road Greenwich SE10 9XR. Garage bulging with rubbish put there by fly tippers. I have already reported this to fix my street but my report has been ignored.

item.title: Bent tree, 25th June
item.description:
The Councils response to my previous on this totally bent tree is ridiculous. All of us tenants in Claremont Crescent comment on the 45' degree arc of the tree, which has clearly not been straightened by the Council. The strap connecting the tree to the existing stake has stretched and allowed the tree to arc over at a ridiculous angle, as per pic supplied. Please reconsider.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Claremont Crescent, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish weekly, 25th June
item.description:
Every week residents of the flats above the shops dumping their rubbish on the street. The foxes split bags open & it flys all over the street. How many times do we have to report this for this to be taken seriously & when are you issuing fines to these residents - the bins are across the road this is just pure laziness& spreads disease. Cleaning each week & Closing these reports does not resolve the issue & the fact that we owners of our homes have to live with these dirty people. & walk on dirty streets with our little children & pets

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ellenborough Road, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
